commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Argh, why? I just don't get it!

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: What's wrong? Struggling with some tricky homework?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Nope, not homework. It's Mifune.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: You don't understand her?

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: C'mon, why should we care about that mean ol' hater anyway?

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: Yeah! We kept our part of the deal and scored over 60 on our exams, so it's not fair that she's still trying to abolish our club.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: She's the student council president, so why won't she keep her own promise?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Yeah... Why is she so set on getting rid of the school idol club?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: That's exactly what I'm trying to figure out.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: How do you mean?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Mifune's methods might be a little forceful, but she generally acts for the good of everyone, right?

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: She does make sure that clubs have all the things they need, at least.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Yeah, except for ours.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: It appears as though the students are more and more in support of her on account of her proactive work.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Yup, she's pretty popular in my class, too.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Hmph! I don't buy it. We tried so hard on our exams, so you'd think she could at least be nice to us.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Don't you think it's weird, though? She's working for the entire student body, so surely she's a good person at heart...

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: So why would someone like that be so adamant about closing down OUR club and nobody else's?

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: That's a good point. She says there's no benefit to school idols, but is that really reason enough to abolish the whole club?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I don't know. I really think this is over-the-top, even for her.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: After seeing how she works with the other clubs, it does seem rather unusual for her to simply tell us to disband.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Well then, why don't we go ask her about it?

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: I kind of doubt she'd be up-front with us.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Knowing her, she'd probably cut us off before we even get a chance to say anything.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: What would we even do with that information in the first place?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: If we hear her out, we might be able to figure out a way to keep her from getting rid of our club. I want to try and mend our relationship with her.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Is that even possible?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: We'll just have to pray that it is and talk to her like Ayumu suggested.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: I suppose you're right. We'll ask her why she wants to get rid of our club, then explain our position as well.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: I sure hope that makes her have a change of heart.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Me too!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Hm, who could that be? Oh! Honoka?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Got it. I'll tell the others. Okay, bye.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: What did Honoka want?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: She invited all of us to a School Idol Festival Planning Committee camp this weekend.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: A camp?

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Ooh, that sounds amazing!

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: While I am concerned about Mifune, it is important for us right now to make sure that the School Idol Festival is a success.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: We left the other groups to do a lot of the work while we were preoccupied with our exams, so I think this will be the perfect opportunity to have a full discussion!

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: I'm all in, too!

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Does that mean we'll be practicing with the others at this camp too?

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: Practicing with everyone else? I like the sound of that.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: I'm so excited.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Should we bring playing cards or something?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: We are not going on this camp purely to have fun.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: I know, but like, we're not gonna be having meetings and practices all day long, right? Just a bit of fun before we go to sleep!

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Yeah! Just a little!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: That means we gotta have pillow fights, too!

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: I'll think of some games as well.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: Me too. I wanna play my heart out.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Me three! Er, I mean, I'll make this camp a productive one no matter what!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Yeah, let's get amped for the camp!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Hahaha. I hope we'll have a lot of fun there.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Huh? Honoka again?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Hello? What's up? Huh? Oh, really? Okay, got it.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Again? Did she forget to mention something?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Well, the camp was gonna be held at Chika's ryokan inn, but both Chika's and Mari's places are pretty packed on the weekend.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: She couldn't find anywhere that could hold all of us, so each group is gonna have to downsize a bit...
